medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset severe headache with motor weakness and visual alterations.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began acutely, characterized by severe headache, dizziness, vomiting, right-sided weakness (more intensive in the arm), and impaired verbal expression lasting 15 hours. Neurologic symptoms improved gradually and disappeared completely after 3 days following nimodipine treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a clinical history of similar episodes of severe headache in the past without motor-sensorial focal deficit, though these were shorter in duration with milder symptoms. Genetic study was positive for CACNA1A mutation.
medical_history.family_history: Family history was of no clinical significance.
